unnormalised: ## The Curious Case of the Missing ₹2000 Note
normalised: ## The Curious Case of the Missing Rupee Two Thousand Note

unnormalised: It all started on a sweltering afternoon in Mumbai. I, Rohan, a budding coder with a penchant for chai and a weakness for online shopping, decided to finally tackle my monthly budget. I’d been putting it off, as usual, dreading the inevitable confrontation with my expenses.
normalised: It all started on a sweltering afternoon in Mumbai. I, Rohan, a budding coder with a penchant for chai and a weakness for online shopping, decided to finally tackle my monthly budget. I’d been putting it off, as usual, dreading the inevitable confrontation with my expenses.

unnormalised: The first task was to deposit some cash into my account. I had a small stash of ₹500 and a few ₹2000 notes I'd been hoarding. The plan was simple: head to the ICICI Bank branch near my office, deposit ₹5000, and then treat myself to a samosa from the street vendor outside. What could possibly go wrong?
normalised: The first task was to deposit some cash into my account. I had a small stash of rupee five hundred and a few rupee two thousand notes I'd been hoarding. The plan was simple: head to the I-C-I-C-I Bank branch near my office, deposit rupee five thousand, and then treat myself to a samosa from the street vendor outside. What could possibly go wrong?

unnormalised: Well, as I was carefully counting the notes, a small drama unfolded. I counted out four crisp ₹500 notes. But when it came to the ₹2000 notes, I found only one! I was absolutely sure I had kept two. Where did that ₹2000 note vanish? Had I spent it unknowingly? The last time I remember using it was on 10/26/2023 at D-Mart.
normalised: Well, as I was carefully counting the notes, a small drama unfolded. I counted out four crisp rupee five hundred notes. But when it came to the rupee two thousand notes, I found only one! I was absolutely sure I had kept two. Where did that rupee two thousand note vanish? Had I spent it unknowingly? The last time I remember using it was on twenty sixth october two thousand and twenty three at D-Mart.

unnormalised: My brain started doing mental gymnastics. Could I have dropped it somewhere? Maybe in the auto-rickshaw ride home? The possibility of retracing my steps in the Mumbai heat was enough to make me sweat more than I already was. The thought of losing ₹2000 was like a tiny stone in my shoe, irritatingly present. I remembered reading somewhere that RBI had announced something about withdrawing these notes. Was this the universe telling me something?
normalised: My brain started doing mental gymnastics. Could I have dropped it somewhere? Maybe in the auto-rickshaw ride home? The possibility of retracing my steps in the Mumbai heat was enough to make me sweat more than I already was. The thought of losing rupee two thousand was like a tiny stone in my shoe, irritatingly present. I remembered reading somewhere that R-B-I had announced something about withdrawing these notes. Was this the universe telling me something?

unnormalised: I spent a good 30 minutes tearing my room apart, revisiting every nook and cranny. Under the bed, inside old textbooks, even in my sock drawer – the ₹2000 note was nowhere to be found. Defeated, I decided to just go ahead with depositing the remaining ₹3000 (₹2000 + ₹500*2). Maybe the samosa would ease the pain.
normalised: I spent a good thirty minutes tearing my room apart, revisiting every nook and cranny. Under the bed, inside old textbooks, even in my sock drawer – the rupee two thousand note was nowhere to be found. Defeated, I decided to just go ahead with depositing the remaining rupee three thousand (rupee two thousand plus rupee five hundred multiplied by two). Maybe the samosa would ease the pain.

unnormalised: At the bank, the teller, a kind lady named Mrs. Sharma, efficiently processed my transaction. "₹3000 deposited, Mr. Rohan," she said with a smile. I managed a weak smile back, still haunted by the missing note.
normalised: At the bank, the teller, a kind lady named Mrs. Sharma, efficiently processed my transaction. "Rupee three thousand deposited, Mister Rohan," she said with a smile. I managed a weak smile back, still haunted by the missing note.

unnormalised: Later that evening, while complaining to my mom over the phone, the mystery was solved. “Beta,” she said calmly, “remember you gave me ₹2000 last week to pay the electricity bill? You said you needed change and I totally forgot to return it to you!" The relief that washed over me was immense. The missing ₹2000 wasn't lost; it was just temporarily misplaced in the labyrinth of family finances. And that samosa? It tasted extra sweet that day.
normalised: Later that evening, while complaining to my mom over the phone, the mystery was solved. “Beta,” she said calmly, “remember you gave me rupee two thousand last week to pay the electricity bill? You said you needed change and I totally forgot to return it to you!" The relief that washed over me was immense. The missing rupee two thousand wasn't lost; it was just temporarily misplaced in the labyrinth of family finances. And that samosa? It tasted extra sweet that day.
